item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, August 28, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The journey of an internet packet: Exploring networks with traceroute (180 points | 61 comments)
2. Diffusion models are real-time game engines (849 points | 296 comments)
3. Formal CHERI: design-time proof of full-scale architecture security properties (62 points | 7 comments)
4. Show HN: IPA, a GUI for exploring inner details of PDFs (113 points | 16 comments)
5. Typing lists and tuples in Elixir (88 points | 11 comments)
6. A dishwasher can make or break a restaurant (2017) (96 points | 197 comments)
7. Show HN: Every open source tool from the "What's HN working on" thread (31 points | 6 comments)
8. COSMIC Alpha Released (189 points | 99 comments)
9. The slow evaporation of the free/open source surplus (51 points | 22 comments)
10. Interview with Signal President Meredith Whittaker (45 points | 23 comments)
11. PC Floppy Copy Protection: Formaster Copy-Lock (22 points | 4 comments)
12. Judge dismisses majority of GitHub Copilot copyright claims (87 points | 30 comments)
13. Wp2hugo: Best WordPress to Hugo migrator (written in Go) (78 points | 27 comments)
14. Prosper AI (YC S23) Hiring a Founding Front End Engineer in Barcelona (hybrid) ( | hide)
15. Microsoft donates the Mono Project to the Wine team (1256 points | 409 comments)
16. A Collection of Free Public APIs That Is Tested Daily (506 points | 99 comments)
17. State and time are the same thing (9 points | 6 comments)
18. French prosecutors say Telegram CEO freed from custody, will appear in court (57 points | 40 comments)
19. Show HN: Relari – Auto Prompt Optimizer as Lightweight Alternative to Finetuning (10 points | discuss)
20. The Monospace Web (528 points | 132 comments)
21. Faster CRDTs (2021) (301 points | 100 comments)
22. Box64 and RISC-V in 2024 (8 points | 1 comment)
23. Tesla’s TTPoE at Hot Chips 2024: Replacing TCP for Low Latency Applications (140 points | 79 comments)
24. ChartDB – Free and open source, database design editor (222 points | 30 comments)
25. Marine worms made at least some trace fossil burrows called Bifungites (38 points | 13 comments)
26. Blitzortung – real time lightning strikes around the world (302 points | 121 comments)
27. Immovable Ladder (5 points | 1 comment)
28. Sapiens: Foundation for Human Vision Models (35 points | 1 comment)
29. CIA Sent Him Deep Undercover to Spy on Islamic Radicals. It Cost Him Everything (31 points | 3 comments)
30. Rerun: Visualize Multimodal Data over Time (124 points | 30 comments)
